Description: Body sherd of East Greek black-figured pottery open vessel, probably krater; whitish slip; interior glazed (very worn); exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of bird or siren (breast and foot remaining), presumably with head turned back; to right, black zone with possible handle root; below, black zone with two bands in added red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Sherd is only labelled as H2016 and shares the same accession number with several other unrelated sherds. Sherd joins Bristol H2016.09
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1095)
